entries.stat_open: Although your stats have been optimized for your starting profession, you may wish to change your stats in order to pursue a different profession, either instead of or in addition to your starting profession.  Once you are in the world, stat migration is a slow progress:  Gradually moving points from one stat to another.  However, in this Tutorial, you may migrate your stats and the changes will take effect immediately.
entries.stat_migration: Although your stats have been optimized for your starting profession, you may wish to change your stats in order to pursue a different profession, either instead of or in addition to your starting profession.  Once you are in the world, stat migration is a slow process:  Gradually moving points from one stat to another.  However, in this Planet Selection Room, you may migrate your stats and the changes will take effect immediately.  If you would like to change your stats now, press CTRL-C and choose the Stat Migration button.
entries.holocube: This is your Holocron.  You can access it by pressing CTRL-H.  Whenever you need information about something in Star Wars Galaxies, press CTRL-H to find it in your Holocron.  To close this screen, press CTRL-H again.
entries.tut_49: The Imperial Officer has directed you to a Skill Trainer.  Converse with the Skill Trainer to learn your first skill.
entries.tut_37: Use the cloning terminal.  You can do this through the radial menu, or you can just double-click.  The cursor changes when over a usable item.
entries.tut_33: When you find hard credits (cash on hand) be sure to deposit them in your bank as soon as possible to avoid losing them.
entries.tut_32: Banks let you deposit and withdraw cash on hand.  You can also use the bank to store items.  You can only retrieve your items from the bank in which you stored the item.  You can only store items in the bank you've joined.  Although you can change banks at any time, you can only be a member of one bank at a time.  You can spend credits from your bank account at most terminals.
entries.select_dest: Select your destination by clicking on one of the planets on the screen.  When you have selected the planet, select which city you wish to travel to by clicking on the picture to the right of the screen.  When you are ready to travel to the city, click on the arrow in the lower right-hand corner of the screen.
entries.tut_56: Move to the next room to deliver your release documents to the Quartermaster.
entries.tut_36: Move down the ramp toward the cloning and insurance terminals.
entries.wrong_bank: You cannot use this bank terminal.  Use the bank terminal in the middle of the room.
entries.newbie_mail: You've received a message.  Press the letter-icon on  your button bar to access your email!
entries.keymap: Star Wars Galaxies contains a variety of different keyboard layouts as well as the ability to remap keys.  After you arrive at your starting planet, access the Options menu by hitting  CTRL-O, select the Controls option and then the Keymap option.
entries.tut_51: You can also check your character status after your fight, by pressing the character-sheet button on the button bar, or CTRL-C.
entries.tut_50: You've picked up your first skill.  There are many skills to master in your chosen profession and there are advanced professions that only open up once you have mastered many skills.  You can check your skills using the skills window.  You can reach this with the skills button on the button bar, or by pressing CTRL-S.
entries.tut_43: You can zoom the overlay map using the mousewheel, while holding down the CTRL key.
entries.tut_45: The hallway is blocked by debris.  Attack it to destroy it.  Then proceed to the next room to face your enemy.
entries.swear_reminder: You cannot become a citizen of Star Wars Galaxies until you promise to abide by the code of conduct.  To swear your oath, type I PROMISE into the chat window and hit the ENTER key.
entries.make_promise: To swear your oath, please type the words I PROMISE into your chat window, and press ENTER.
entries.tut_55_waypoints: Waypoints indicate destinations.  When you have a job or mission, you can follow the waypoint on your radar.  They appear light blue.
entries.mission_terminal: You cannot take a mission from this terminal.  To take a mission, you will need to find a mission terminal on a planet.
entries.tut_44_attacking: When you hover your cursor over someone, your cursor changes to let you know that you can attack them.  Double-clicking them will attack them.  You can also cycle through targets with the tab key.
entries.receive_weapon: A weapon has been added to your inventory.
entries.tut_00_toolbardrag: You can drag items into your toolbar for easy access.  Simply click on the item and then drag it to an open slot on your toolbar.  Press the corresponding function key to use the item.
entries.tut_60: Thank you.  You are now a citizen of Star Wars Galaxies.
entries.the_oath: I promise to treat my fellow players and citizens with respect and to obey the code of conduct
entries.oath_explain: You are required to promise to obey the code of conduct and to treat your fellow players with respect, before moving on.
entries.tut_54: You can also speak to npcs and do tasks for them.  There's one over there who has something for you to do.
entries.tut_53: Mission terminals like those to your left are located throughout the world.  Whenever you want a quick adventure you can always take a job from a mission terminal.
entries.tut_13: Remember, you don't speak to other players this way.  Just type to talk to other players.  When you are finished conversing with the Imperial Officer, select the STOP CONVERSING option.
entries.tut_12: Now you're in a conversation.  You can choose one of the responses to the right with your mouse.
entries.tut_11: Do you see the option to converse?  While holding your mouse button, move to the converse option and let go of the mouse button to select it.
entries.tut_10: Click and hold the mouse button to get  a radial menu on the Imperial Officer.
entries.tut_09: He is now your look-at target.  His name appears over his head.
entries.tut_08: Move forward and click-and-hold your mouse on the Imperial Officer until the radial menu appears.
entries.loot_pirate: Congratulations!  The pirate has been destroyed.  Now you can loot his corpse by clicking and holding your mouse on him until you get the radial menu option to LOOT.
entries.radar_more: The red dots show potentially aggressive entities.  Yellow dots indicate peaceful life signatures.  You can also access an overlay map with CTRL-M.  Press CTRL-M again to turn it off.
entries.part_8: PART EIGHT OF NINE (missions and waypoints)
entries.part_5: PART FIVE OF NINE (combat moves and radar)
entries.part_4: PART FOUR OF NINE (cloning and insurance)
entries.part_3: PART THREE OF NINE (banking and shopping)
entries.part_2: PART TWO OF NINE (conversing with npcs and inventory)
entries.part_1: PART ONE OF NINE (movement and chat)
entries.choose_destination: Please select a destination from the sub-menu.
entries.explain_combat_3: You can attack hostile creatures simply by double-clicking them.
entries.explain_combat_2: The ATTACK option on the radial menu will be the default attack for hostile creatures.
entries.explain_combat_1: In combat, you can spend your HEALTH, MIND or ACTION pools to invoke special attacks.
entries.declare_insured: All of your items have been insured!
entries.declare_cloned: Your clone data has been saved!
entries.move_to_cloning: Take the elevator down and visit our state-of-the-art cloning facility.
entries.bazaar_info_3: Everything from large quantities of resources, to specialized items can be bought and sold at the bazaar terminal.
entries.bazaar_info_2: In addition to the basic item dispensers, you'll find a number of terminals that will connect you to the galactic bazaar.
entries.bazaar_info_1: This is an item dispenser.  You can use it to buy basic items in the game.
entries.bank_info_5: When you find hard credits (cash on hand), be sure to deposit them in your bank as soon as possible to avoid losing them.
entries.bank_info_4: You can spend credits from your bank account at most terminals.
entries.bank_info_3: Although you can change banks at any time, you can only be a member of one bank at a time.
entries.bank_info_2: You can only retrieve your items from the bank in which you stored the item.  You can only store items in the bank you've joined.
entries.bank_info_1: Banks let you deposit and withdraw cash on hand.  You can also use the bank to store items.
entries.explain_alt_key: Press the ALT key to toggle free-mouse mode on and off.
entries.close_inventory: Press CTRL-I again to close your inventory window.
entries.repeat_open_inventory: Press CTRL-I to open your inventory, and select one of the food items you found in the crate.
entries.repeat_closestatus_prompt: Now press CTRL-C again to close your character status screen.
entries.repeat_status_prompt: Press CTRL-C to view your character status screen.
entries.mousewheel_repeat: Give it a try.  Scroll out to 3rd-person and take a look at yourself.
entries.use_toolbar: To use the item on your toolbar, press the function-key which corresponds with the toolbar slot.  F1 is the first slot.  F12 is the last slot.
entries.move_to_toolbar: Move a food item from your inventory to a blank slot on your toolbar.
entries.show_toolbar: This is your toolbar.  You can put things on it for instant access.
entries.explain_item_used: You used the item on yourself.  Food will help increase your attributes.  Medicine will help you recover damage to your attributes.
entries.prompt_use_item: Select the Use option to use this item.
entries.prompt_find_food: Scroll through your inventory until you locate one of the food items that you've just picked-up.
entries.explain_inventory: You can examine your inventory by pressing CTRL-I.
entries.explain_freemouse_toggle: You can toggle the mouse mode yourself with the ALT key.
entries.explain_freemouse: Notice that your mouse mode changed when you opened that container.
entries.repeat_visit_commerce: No need to stick around here all day.  Walk down the corridor to the next area.
entries.pickup_complete: You've put the item in your inventory.
entries.prompt_select_pickup: Now choose the Pick Up option to move the item to your inventory.
entries.prompt_take_items: You can take these items by clicking-and-holding until you get the radial menu option on each item.  Pick up all of the items, and then click the X in the upper-right-hand corner of the container to close the box.
entries.repeat_open_box: You might find something in the box you need.  Click and hold your mouse-button down on the box until you see the radial menu.
entries.prompt_choose_open: Great!  Now select the Open option to access the contents of the container.
entries.prompt_open_box: To open the box just click and hold until you see the radial menu appear.
entries.close_status_prompt: Press CTRL-C again to toggle your character status screen off.
entries.open_status_prompt: Good job.  Now I want you to look at your character status screen.  Press CTRL-C.
entries.repeat_item_room_prompt: Come on.  Don't keep me waiting all day.
entries.move_to_item_room: Excellent!  Come through the door and down the hallway there.
entries.repeatchatprompt: Don't be shy.  Type something in your chatwindow and press Enter.
entries.chatprompt: Go ahead and try it.  Just type what you want to say and then press ENTER.
entries.chatwindow: This is your chat window.  Type here to speak to your fellow players.
entries.radar: If you're going down that hallway, you might want advanced warning of what's down there.  This is your radar.
entries.mousewheel: Using the mouse-wheel, scroll forward to zoom into your character.  Notice that if you zoom in all the way, you'll be in first-person mode.  Scroll backwards to zoom-out of your character, and into third-person mode.  You can also zoom your camera in and out by pressing the keypad plus and minus keys.  Try zooming between 1st and 3rd person.
entries.lookaround: You can look around by moving your mouse.
entries.movement_mouse: Or hold down the right mouse-button to move forward.
entries.movement_keyboard: Use the arrow keys to move.
